page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY, CHITTERNE
page.content: The War Office bought most of the agricultural land in All Saint's Parish of Chitterne in 1937, including farms and farm cottages. Until this time water had been obtained from two communal wells or from garden wells by those who had their own. The War Office brought piped water to the properties they had bought and this came from two windmills situated on the hills on either side of Chitterne. The West Wilts. Water Authority was permitted to tap these pipes to provide water for the rest of the village. Mains water came in 1969. Electricity also came in 1937. Older people in the village remember the narrow road and humpback bridge and how the village was often flooded in winter. Many people had friends and relations in Imber and would walk across the Plain to visit them.
